Iterative Fluctuation

Source: R/tmle-shift_ID.R
f_iter.Rd

Iterative Fluctuation

f_iter(Qn, gn, gn0d = NULL, prev_sum = 0, first = FALSE, h_int, Y, A,
  W, delta, A_val)

Arguments

Qn

Function to compute the outcome regression: Q(A, W) = E(Y | A, W).
gn

Function to compute the propensity score: g(A, W) = density(A | W).
gn0d

A Numeric computed for the propensity score (gn) from the first iteration only.
prev_sum

The sum computed from this fluctuation step in the previous iteration.
first

A logical for whether this is the first iteration of the iterative fluctutation step.
h_int

???
Y

A numeric vector of observed outcomes.
A

A numeric vector of observed treatments.
W

A matrix or data.frame of baseline covariates.
delta

A numeric for the shift to be placed on the treatment of interest (i.e., the effect of shifting treatment A by delta units).
A_val

A vector of numeric values for the points in the range of the treatment A to approximate integrals by Riemmann sums. Note that these must be equally spaced along a grid.

Contents

  • Arguments
